example.name: all args
example.text: But at just that moment, he is interrupted in his office by a servant in tuxedo who *trace* pours coffee from silver into a cup of china and dabs the brim with linen.

example.name: ergative, with source
example.text: Billions of investors' dollars are pouring out of the nation's junk-bond mutual funds, undermining a pillar of support in the already reeling junk market.
example.arg: out of the nation's junk-bond mutual funds
undermining a pillar of support in the already reeling junk market

example.name: pouring beer
example.text: Although imports account for less than 1% of beer sales in Japan, [Asahi Breweries Ltd., which has been gaining share with its popular dry beer,]-1 plans *trace*-1 to fend off Japanese competitors by *trace*-1 pouring $1.06 billion into facilities to brew 50% more beer.
example.arg: into facilities to brew 50% more beer

roles.note: Don't tag weather "it"; this verb rarely takes any arguments. (from pour.02-v)

example.name: pour-v: all wet
example.text: "Be sure to wear your raincoat," Mary said to John. "It's pouring outside."

example.name: pouring-j
example.text: Just the howling wind and the pouring rain otherwise.

roleset.name: gush, as liquid, emotion, etc.
roleset.note: OUTPOURING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, relation to pour.01. No VNcls. (from outpouring.01-n)

example.name: outpouring-n: args 1, 2
example.text: This park in northeastern India, set along the Brahmaputra River near its outpouring from the Himalaya, sports floodplain grasslands and forests rich in large mammals.

example.name: outpouring-n: args0, 1
example.text: Amid his outpouring of dour facts, Jared Diamond pauses to wonder. "What did the Easter Islander who cut down the last palm tree say while he was doing it?"

example.name: pour_out-v
example.text: The sudden passing of a high school student shocked the tight-knit community, which-1 *-1 poured out support to the Donnelly family online and in person.
